OriginalSource.Creator: Terese WInslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Made a gradient of color from the papillary dermis down to where the reticular dermis starts, and then added a dotted line there.

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Clark levels of skin cancer; drawing shows skin with five thin lesions of different depths. In the first lesion (Clark Level I), the cancer is in the epidermis only. In the second lesion (Clark Level II), the cancer has begun to spread into the papillary dermis (upper layer of the dermis). In the third lesion (Clark Level III), the cancer has spread through the papillary dermis into the papillary-reticular dermal interface but not into the reticular dermis (lower layer of the dermis). In the fourth lesion (Clark Level IV), the cancer has spread into the reticular dermis. In the fifth lesion (Clark Level V), the cancer has spread into the subcutaneous tissue.

Captions.MediaCaption: Clark levels of skin cancer. In Clark Level I, the cancer is in the epidermis only. In Clark Level II, the cancer has begun to spread into the papillary dermis (upper layer of the dermis). In Clark Level III, the cancer has spread through the papillary dermis into the papillary-reticular dermal interface but not into the reticular dermis (lower layer of the dermis). In Clark Level IV, the cancer has spread into the reticular dermis. In Clark Level V, the cancer has spread into the subcutaneous tissue.

DatedAction.ActionDescription: Add to Clark level glossary terms when they are approved and published.

ProcessingStatus.Comment: 2010-11-22: Revised content description and caption per OCCM; aj.

ProcessingStatus.ProcessingStatusValue: Approved by expert reviewer with changes
ProcessingStatus.Comment: Reviewer comment: This illustration shows the papillary dermis as very thin and the papillary-reticular interface being rather thick. The interface is more of a conceptual zone between the two than a defined large space as depicted. Normally it is illustrated as a line or dotted line.
Sending revised version back to Russ Berman.
Updated to ClarkLevelsMelanoma3.jpg, ready for review.
